member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncMethodContainerAttribute
member.summary: Declares a type within an assembly to contain methods decorated by either or .

remarks.para: This assembly-level attribute is required for assemblies that contain custom methods when WebSync is configured to run with targetedScan=true (see web.config options). Only assemblies which declare this attribute will be checked for - or -decorated methods, and only within the type specified.
This attribute can be defined multiple times if multiple types contain decorated WebSync methods.

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.ScriptType
member.summary: The WebSync script type.

remarks.para: This enumeration describes all possible WebSync script types delivered by the .
Script types can be combined using the bitwise OR (|) operator. This can be useful when using to define server-side script modifier methods, as the same code can be used for multiple script types.
The following example illustrates combining script types in a single script modifier method.

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncScriptModifierAttribute
member.summary: Declares a static method to be invoked on events related to JavaScript client delivery to browser-based clients.

remarks.para: Decorating a method with this attribute will cause it to attach to the specified and execute whenever that is requested by a new browser-based client. Decorated methods can be declared anywhere, but the recommended practice is to create a static containing class (i.e. WebSyncMethods) that houses all decorated methods. If WebSync is configured to run with targetedScan=true (see web.config options), then it is necessary to define the assembly-level for each class containing WebSync script modifier methods.

Use of this attribute is intended for application developers writing custom code as well as third-party WebSync extension developers. When writing a third-party extension for distribution, defining is not optional.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The priority with which the method should execute (lowest values execute first).

member.name: P:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncScriptModifierAttribute.ScriptType
member.summary: The script type(s) to which the method should attach.

member.name: P:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncScriptModifierAttribute.Priority

member.name: P:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncEventArgs.Forced
member.summary: Whether or not the event was forced by an external trigger and therefore ignores any changes to (cannot be cancelled).

remarks.para: This property is true under very specific conditions:

list.item: A client disconnecting with subscribed channels forces an implicit unsubscribe of those channels. If a disconnecting client was subscribed to any channels, then after with is fired, and with will be fired sequentially with this property set to true.

A client being disconnected due to idling forces a disconnect as well as an implicit unsubscribe of any subscribed channels. If an idling client was subscribed to any channels, , , , with will be fired sequentially with this property set to true. If an idling client was not subscribed to any channels, and will not fire.

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.EventType
member.summary: The WebSync event type.

remarks.para: This enumeration describes all possible WebSync server-side events triggered by clients, publishers, server-side methods, and the idling client detector. (See for descriptions of the sources that can trigger events.)
Event types can be combined using the bitwise OR (|) operator. This can be especially useful when using to define server-side event methods, as the same code can be used for multiple event types.
The following example illustrates combining event types in a single event method.

member.summary: Gets or sets the stream host JavaScript clients are instructed to stream over. Only the domain itself is required (eg. www.example.com, not http://www.example.com/). See the JavaScript documentation on the stream property of the initialize method for details on how the client determines what stream host to use.

member.name: P:FM.WebSync.Server.Configuration.ServerConfig.LatencyBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the latency buffer which allots "grace" periods of time for high-latency clients. Lower values will increase the rate at which old clients and messages are cleaned up at the risk of missed messages or removed client records for slow clients. Higher values offer higher reliability with potential performance costs. Defaults to 10000 (10s).

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.ClientHandler
member.summary: HTTP handler that services requests for the JavaScript/HTML client.

remarks.para: This handler is intended to deliver the JavaScript/HTML client to web pages that integrate with WebSync. The path to the handler is specified by its registration in web.config (system.web/httpHandlers or system.webServer/handlers).

It is possible to attach custom code to the delivery process. This allows the JavaScript client and HTML frame to be modified en-route to the client requesting them. Simply declare a static method and decorate it with .
If HttpContext.Session data is required in custom code, use instead of this class in web.config. Note that the overhead associated with .NET session handling will decrease performance.
See below for an example of how to attach to the client delivery and obfuscate the JavaScript code.

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Defines all possible error codes used in WebSync. Error codes are grouped into 4 categories:
600-level: indicate that the request could not be started
700-level: indicate that a provider error occurred while the request was processing
800-level: indicate that the request was denied by an event handler
900-level: indicate that an internal server error occurred when processing the request

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.DeserializationFailure
member.summary: This error occurs when the message and/or publication sent to WebSync was invalid JSON.
member.remarks: The error text is: 601::Could not deserialize incoming messages or publications.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.EmptyRequest
member.summary: This error occurs when WebSync receives an empty POST or GET request.
member.remarks: The error text is: 602::Incoming request was empty.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.InvalidClientId
member.summary: This error indicates that the client ID specified in the request was not valid on the server. This can occur if 1) the server was reset and lost all its client information or 2) the client passed an invalid client ID after awakening from standby or some other client failure. Typically, this error will not be fatal, and will just cause the client to reconnect.
member.remarks: The error text is: 604::Invalid client ID.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.PublisherNotAllowed
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to do a direct HTTP publish to a WebSync server, but direct HTTP publishing has been disabled. To enable direct HTTP publishing, edit your Web.configs httpDirectPublish entry as described in Security.
member.remarks: The error text is: 606::HTTP publication is disabled. Check your web.config settings.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.UserLimit
member.summary: This error occurs when the client limit is reached for the Community Edition.
member.remarks: The error text is: 607::User limit reached. The Community Edition is limited to 10 concurrent users.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.DomainKey
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt to use domain keys other than the default are used in the Community Edition.
member.remarks: The error text is: 608::Invalid domain key. The Community Edition is limited to the default domain key.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.NoRequestHandler
member.summary: This error occurs when the request handler failed to initialize. Typically, this results from an incorrectly configured web.config, such as missing handlers, invalid types for the handlers, etc. If logging is configured, there will be additional details available in your logs.
member.remarks: The error text is: 609::The request handler could not be initialized. Check your web.config settings and logs.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.NoThreadPool
member.summary: This error occurs when the thread pool used for managing incoming requests could not be initialized. Typically, this results from an incorrectly configured web.config, such as missing handlers, invalid handler types, etc. If logging is configured, there will be additional details available in your logs.
member.remarks: The error text is: 610::The thread pool has not been initialized. Check your web.config handler settings.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.HandshakeFailure
member.summary: This error occurs when the client's attempt to connect to the server was denied. This could be for any number of reasons; check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 701::The handshake could not be completed.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.NoConnectionType
member.summary: This error occurs when the client does not support any of the connection types supported by the server. This should never occur when using WebSync Server in association with a WebSync client. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 702::A common connection type could not be negotiated.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.BindFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the client attempted to bind a key/value to itself, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: The record(s) could not be bound.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.UnbindFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the client attempted to unbind a key from itself, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: The record(s) could not be unbound.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.SubscribeFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the client attempted to subscribe to a channel, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 721::The channel(s) could not be subscribed.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.PublishFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that a client attempted to publish to a channel, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 731::The data could not be published.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.UnsubscribeFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the client attempted to unsubscribe from a channel, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 741::The channel(s) could not be unsubscribed.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.DisconnectFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the client attempted to disconnect from the server, but failed. Check your server logs for details.
member.remarks: The error text is: 751::The client could not be disconnected.

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.GenericEventFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that an error occurred or the request was flagged as unsuccessful in an event handler. A typical example of this would be authentication failure. The [Anything] represents the actual error text specified by the developer.
member.remarks: The error text is: 801::[Anything].

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.GenericWebSyncException
member.summary: This error occurs when an unexpected exception occurs within WebSync itself. If this error occurs, more details will be available in the logs (if configured). The [Anything] will contain the error messages from the source of the error. This should *never* be seen, so if you do, please contact us.
member.remarks: The error text is: 901::[Anything]

member.name: F:FM.WebSync.Server.ErrorCode.GenericIISException
member.summary: This error occurs when an unexpected exception occurs within the request handling of IIS. If this error occurs, more details will be available in the logs (if configured). The [Anything] will contain the error messages from the source of the error.
member.remarks: The error text is: 901::[Anything]

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.RequestHandler
member.summary: HTTP handler that services Bayeux client/publisher requests.

remarks.para: This handler is intended to be the primary endpoint for all Bayeux clients and publishers that integrate with WebSync. The path to the handler is specified by its registration in web.config (system.web/httpHandlers or system.webServer/handlers).
Several static methods on this class provide easy access to client and server manipulation, including:

list.item: Binding a client to a record ()
Unbinding a client from a record ()
Subscribing a client to a channel ()
Unsubscribing a client from a channel ()
Getting the total number of clients ()
Getting the total number of clients subscribed to a channel ()
Getting the IDs of all clients ()
Getting the IDs of all clients subscribed to a channel ()
Getting the IDs and bound records of all clients subscribed to a channel ()

remarks.para: It is possible to attach custom code to the request handling process. This allows the requests to be modified on their way to the server, and the responses to be modified on their way back to the source client/publisher. To start, simply declare a static method and decorate it with .
If HttpContext.Session data is required in custom code, use instead of this class in web.config. Note that the overhead associated with .NET session handling will decrease performance.
See below for an example of how to attach to the event and authenticate the request.

member.name: T:FM.WebSync.Server.WebSyncEventAttribute
member.summary: Declares a static method to be invoked on events related to the processing of WebSync requests.

remarks.para: Decorating a method with this attribute will cause it to attach to the specified and execute whenever that is raised. Decorated methods can be declared anywhere, but the recommended practice is to create a static containing class (i.e. WebSyncMethods) that houses all decorated methods. If WebSync is configured to run with targetedScan=true (see web.config options), then it is necessary to define the assembly-level for each class containing WebSync event methods.

Use of this attribute is intended for application developers writing custom code as well as third-party WebSync extension developers. When writing a third-party extension for distribution, defining is not optional.
